title.narrative: 2.3 YOUTH PARTICIPATION AND ENGAGEMENT

description.narrative: National partners have increased knowledge and capacities to connect, activate and engage adolescent girls and boys in decision making and contribution to a peace and resilient society, which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Reducing Child Poverty, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, adolescent girls and boys especially the most vulnerable have benefited from an improved skill-driven formal and non- formal education system, increased opportunity for civic engagement and participation, and strengthened protective environment from all forms of violence, exploitation and abuse for a smooth transition to adulthood

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National partners have increased knowledge and capacities to connect, activate and engage adolescent girls and boys in decisionmaking and contribution to a peace and resilient society

description.narrative: UNICEF continued supporting capacity building of Youth Development platforms, youth participation in local decision making and girls empowerment. Explosive ordnance risk education (EORE) in the most affected communities deployed a comprehensive approach (needs assessment, production of traditional and digital information, education and communication (IEC) materials, the establishment of Community EORE Committees, training of schoolteachers followed by EORE training in schools, community EORE information sessions and EORE activities) to address critical EORE aspects while undertaking awareness-raising campaign. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:24/01/2022
